properties.label: Access Key
properties.name: accessKey
properties.description: An AWS Access Key ID identifies an AWS access key, which can be used to make secure REST or HTTP query protocol requests to AWS service APIs.

properties.label: Secret Key
properties.name: secretKey
properties.description: An AWS Secret Key can be used to make secure REST or HTTP query protocol requests to AWS service APIs.

properties.label: Region
properties.name: region
properties.description: When you launch an Amazon EMR cluster, you must specify a region. You might choose a region to reduce latency, minimize costs, or address regulatory requirements. For more information, refer to https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ManagementGuide/emr-plan-region.html.

properties.label: EC2 Subnet
properties.name: ec2SubnetId
properties.description: A subnet defines a subset of a VPC (virtual private cloud) dedicated to your AWS account. For more information, refer to https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ManagementGuide/emr-vpc-launching-job-flows.html and https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonVPC/latest/UserGuide/VPC_Subnets.html#vpc-subnet-basics.

properties.label: Additional EMR managed security group for the master instance
properties.name: additionalMasterSecurityGroup
properties.description: An additional EMR managed security group that will be applied to the master instance. For more information, refer to https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ManagementGuide/emr-man-sec-groups.html.

widget-attributes.placeholder: Specify your EMR managed security group

properties.label: Logs URI
properties.name: logsURI
properties.description: Copy the cluster's log files automatically to S3. For more information, refer to https://docs.aws.amazon.com/console/elasticmapreduce/logging.

properties.label: Number of instances
properties.name: instanceCount
properties.description: Total number of instances in the cluster. One of them will be a master instance.
